storyInfo: Siege, devoid of any goal, begins to doubt herself. Dublinn forces, the 'Trilby Asher' and Rhodes Island spar verbally over the comms station, only to discover in the end that it had long ago been removed.

attributes.content: Morgan's brought a few people back already. They're getting their medicine now.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Dagda and Hannah are looking for anyone who might still be hidden in the ruins.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: You know the state the plate's been in these days... Barely anyone'll poke their face into the street anymore.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Bet there's a good few tucked away shivering in cubicles in some skyscraper, living off whatever scraps they can pick once it's night.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Siege, you're gonna find them all?
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: I know I'm obviously not going to be able to save every person.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: But what matters is, we let them know an evacuation's about to happen.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Otherwise, once the dukes start firing their artillery, the majority aren't going to realize that's their opportunity to leave, and they'll just find some way to hide even better.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: That's their choice. Maybe they'll end up still alive when the Sarkaz leave.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: But they need to know there are other options.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Hrmph. Fine, fine. Other options...
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: There's a few places I heard signs of life from a few days ago... I hope it wasn't just wild beasts digging at the wreckage for eats.
attributes.name: Cador

attributes.content: Morgan, what's wrong? You look funny.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: No... I'm fine.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I'm just... haha, just a little bit thrown.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Old boy Strauss and Granny Amir got into a fight over a single jab of first-aid inhibitor. One of 'em blinded the other in one eye.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Me and Amiya busted our arses getting them off each other again, but that eye's hopeless now.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: We didn't bring that much medicine in the first place, and everyone's gathered outside, and some of them are in a... an awful panic.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: They're worrying they might get infected. Some of them haven't even realized they already are Infected.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Amiya says she hasn't been contacted by Ines on time. She needs to check on how her and the Doctor are doing.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I... I couldn't hang around there any longer on my own. Came here to catch my breath.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: You're real chummy with the people you brought back.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: I grew up here since I was a kid, after all. I'm willing to bet not even you or Hannah know Norport as well as I do, let alone Siege.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: You were always wandering around town back then whenever you had nothing to do.
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Yeah. Forget back of my hand, I know Norport like my palm. Every little crease and fold and where it goes.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Vina, I... I was off trying to find all these people I'd known for yonks.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I tried looking for McClaren again. And it's not that he won't respond to us...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: He's gone deaf. I saw blood coming from his ears.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I wrote a quick note for him. Should've seen it, clear as day, but... he just went and hid back inside.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: And Karsh, guy who ran the record store. Used to trick me into buying awful vinyls, just the stalest stuff. Don't know how much money I wasted at his.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: His legs, one of his legs is... nothing like a leg should look like. God knows how he shuffled over here.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Brenda, the one doing import clothes. She always lent me these fashion magazines from Lungmen to read.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I did some treatment on her burns for her, but...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: And Claire, Eileen, Itoh...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I know every one of them!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Vina, did we come back just so we could see all this?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: What the hell did we come back for?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Vina, Vina, if all we can do is watch on while this happens, if we don't have any way to change anything, then maybe we should've just... forgotten about this place at all?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: You know I've read the heroes' sagas. Their terrific adventures and journeys, their chivalry and justice, defeating the evil—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: But anyone outside of the hero's just a backdrop to the legend. They just exist in the story so the main character has someone to talk to, a chance to grow.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: I always thought that was our kind of story. I was always so bleeding proud of myself...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: But I know every one of them! God's sakes, I know every one of them!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Like this would be some bloody outline of monster wrecks village, hero kills monster—it's not that simple.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: This isn't some stupid—cliched revenge story.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Vina, twenty years I lived with them in my life. They're not names for a grieving hero to check off out loud. They're not flashbacks they can stuff into an aside before they kill a villain.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: They... they shouldn't be...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Morgan, I know what you—
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Vina! Alexandrina Vina Victoria!
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Did you come back to this country to take a crown which was rightfully yours, to create eternal legends of yet another Aslan King—
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Or did you do it to come back home?
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Vina, I'm begging you, tell me, tell me this isn't going to be forever...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: You can tell me we just... need to hold on a little longer.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Tears fall from the face of someone Siege couldn't know any better.
To her memory, she's practically never seen Morgan crying outside of the video shop.
The Sighs of Kings is ever ice-cold. The Sighs of Kings is ever silent.
I'm sorry, Vina, I don't blame you or anything...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: ...I just was walking on the street, and I looked up, and it all hit me...
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: We've lost Norport Borough. We really have.
attributes.name: Morgan

attributes.content: Morgan!
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Vina, I...
attributes.name: Baird

attributes.content: Their friends back out. The room falls silent. Like all the past liveliness and merriment that took place in here was one long hallucination.
The furnishings, same as they were, hardly different to when they left.
Nothing remains here.
Over the prior days, Siege has constantly, subconsciously been feeling the sword named the Sighs of Kings.
Once again, out of habit, she puts her hand to the hilt.
She tries to feel some sort of energy from it, some sort of motivation. Even some kind of duty or preordained self-sacrificial destiny would be fine.
Again. And again. She is left disappointed.
What did she come back for? Just to experience all of this?

Or did all that expectation simply fall upon the wrong person when it chose her? Did this sword, and her teacher, foster too much of an illusion in her—to the point she thought she could be some kind of symbol?
Siege has never hated her own irresolution as badly as this.
Morgan.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Maybe... I came back, just so I wouldn't regret it. Just so I wouldn't realize, years down the line, that I never did anything when I first could.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: I don't know where I'll go from here... but I just—can't bear this.
attributes.name: Siege

attributes.content: Is that a fable, Mr. Colbert?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Are you attempting to describe Victoria?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Fable? No, no, I don't like to beat around the bush when I talk. I'm just waxing nostalgic, as the old do.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: We have to pass the time talking about something, you know, sitting here.
attributes.name: Colbert

attributes.content: May I just say that I pay more attention to the future, Sarkaz 'of Victoria.'
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Taran, you make ample preparations. Presumably you've brought a considerable headcount in.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: But on the other hand, I'd think you wouldn't want to be battling for life and death with us.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Stay put here and behave, and nothing will happen.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Are you out to monopolize the technology of that airship?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: And did the Duke of Caster send you to this plate just to take a walk?
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: We can share. The Sarkaz's defense of the airship... can't be that lax. It wouldn't be an easy mission for anyone, certainly.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: But if we work together, then this technology can belong to more than just a duke. It can be Victoria's.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I don't care about Victoria.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Well, it seems you've made up your mind.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You spoke that our goals were quite in agreement. Synergy.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: In light of that, I will trouble you as little as I can, pet of Caster.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Though you were dying to kill me a moment ago.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: What? Would you like me to apologize?
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Your mission failure will incur no more than a demotion in rank, while your life is preserved in any case.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: If you are insistent on commendation and promotion from Duke Caster, you are welcome to try.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Old Wellington's underlings are as stubborn as him, that much I have the privilege of seeing now.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Fine. I can stay here, and I'll yield the airship's technology to you.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: But I stipulate something in exchange.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.options: Seems you're about to reevaluate our relationship.

attributes.content: Indeed it does, Doctor of Rhodes Island.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You refused my offer of friendship, so to being a pawn you'll have to return.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I'll be taking the Realmblade. The Windermere girl and Alexandrina must die here.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Given in, Miss Successor?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: I did not receive orders to intervene in this.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: I'll take that as an agreement.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: As long as a deal has been made, the Duke of Caster forever honors her commitments. Every single one.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: You've no worries, 'Brigadier.' That's our foremost tenet.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: (Understood.)
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Does every Victorian do that? Never ask the people in question for their opinion?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: I think, Mr. 'Trilby Asher,' I just told you a second ago your metaphors suck.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: And calling us pawns, that's a metaphor.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: So Rhodes Island is hanging onto ties with the Duke of Windermere as its last thread?
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: That's not a good idea. You're on the wrong team.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: We don't have to pick a team to start.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Then you can only—
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Wait...
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: That Windermere girl... Is that illusionist and shadow Arts combined?!
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Where is she?
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Rhodes!
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Impressive rapport there, Mr. 'Trilby Asher.'
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: It's a question of our tenets, after all.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: The thing about honoring commitments forever?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: No, a different one.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Never let the winner take all.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: This is all meaningless now, Taran. If this lot send their message out, the dukes' main fleets will be forced to push in.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: And at that point, the airship goes to whoever takes it down.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: It seems none of us will be bringing home the gold.
attributes.name: 'Trilby Asher'

attributes.content: Fine.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Doctor, careful!
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Miss Ines, I made it.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: We saw the shadows outside the door.
attributes.name: Amiya

attributes.content: Rhodes Island... The Duke would rather not fall out with you.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Didn't your actions just now amount to a fallout?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Fine, fine. Feel free to apologize.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Then may we meet again, someday.
attributes.name: 'The Brigadier'

attributes.content: Dublinn army corpses...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: They did set up people here.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Their wounds are fresh, can't have been made long ago. Blade cuts, some seem like they're cauterized...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Who's there?!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The room is oppressively vacant. No one responds.
Delphine grips her dagger tight.

Her mother always admonished her for not putting more energy into combat training, but being the daughter of the Duke of Windermere of Victoria, her swordsmanship reputed, she's got the confidence to take on most enemies.
Comms station should be around here...
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Wh—What the hell...?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: A tangled cord of wires comes into Delphine's view, but the device meant to attach to them has vanished without a trace.
All that's left on the table is a thick layer of dust.
Someone came and took the comms station away beforehand... long beforehand.
